item.title: Using AWS CLI to Search Multiple Files with S3 Select
item.description:
Environment

  • aws-cli 2.7.14

Overview

I needed to search through CloudFront logs stored in S3.
Since Athena was not available, I used S3 Select for the search.

However, S3 Select can only search one file at a time.
To handle multiple files, I integrated AWS CLI into a shell script.

Steps

Here are the conditions:

  • The S3 bucket name is target-bucket-name.
  • Files are generated in the logs-dir directory with the format AABBCCDDEE123456.YYYY-MM-DD-HH.abcdefg….
  • The AWS CLI profile is named my-aws-profile.

Below is the completed script:

item.title: Downgrading the AmazonLinux2023 kernel
item.description:
Environment

  • Amazon Linux 2023.5.20240819

Overview

I upgraded the kernel of AmazonLinux2023 and downgraded some tools that stopped working.
This is a record of that operating procedure.

Procedure

First, check the current kernel status.

$uname -r
6.1.102-111.182.amzn2023.x86_64

$ sudo dnf list kernel
kernel.x86_64   6.1.92-99.174 amzn2023     @amazonlinux
kernel.x86_64   6.1.96-102.177.amzn2023    @amazonlinux
kernel.x86_64   6.1.102-111.182.amzn2023   @amazonlinux

It is currently at 6.1.102 and will downgrade to 6.1.96.

Probably the shortest way.

First, downgrade and restart.
You can revert to a specific version by specifying “package name - version”.

item.title: Allow python commands to be used on Windows without administrative privileges
item.description:
Environment

  • Windows 11
  • git bash
  • Python 3.12.4

Background

The PC I use for work does not get administrator rights, but I needed to use Python.
I prepared an environment where I can use Python without administrator rights.

Procedure

Download Embedded Python

You can download Python from the following site and download the “Windows embeddable package”.
https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3124/

Unzip the downloaded ZIP file to a folder of your choice and modify the python312._pth in it.
Simply uncomment one line.

item.title: Scrum's story point about “not estimating by the hour” is
item.description:
Background

I usually work as a scrum master in scrum development.

I have the developers estimate in story points.
Story points are not estimated in “man-hours”, but instead in “difficulty” or “effort”.

However, members were having trouble with this expression because it was so fluffy.
Different members have different interpretations, and although we don’t estimate in man-hours to begin with, we sometimes determine which tickets can be implemented in a sprint based on story points,
In the end, everyone was thinking in terms of relative man-hours for each ticket, and it was very agonizing.

item.title: 【AWS】Bypassing MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) to Clone a Repository from CodeCommit
item.description:
Environment

  • MacBook Pro (Sonoma 14.5, M1 chip)
  • aws-cli/2.15.14
  • aws-mfa 0.0.12

Steps

This guide explains how to clone a repository from CodeCommit in an environment where MFA authentication is required for AWS access.
Most search results focused on disabling MFA for CodeCommit, which was not helpful, so I decided to document the process.

Installing AWS CLI

If AWS CLI is not installed, refer to the following page for installation:
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/getting-started-install.html

Installing aws-mfa

There is a tool that makes MFA authentication easier when using AWS from the command line:
https://github.com/broamski/aws-mfa

item.title: 【AWS】Using Paramiko for SFTP Communication in Lambda
item.description:
Environment

  • MacBook Air (M1 chip)
  • AWS SAM version 1.99.0
  • Python 3.9

Steps

To retrieve files via SFTP from another server, we use the Paramiko library.
Since AWS Lambda does not include Paramiko by default, we will use a Lambda layer.

Lambda layers can be built using Docker, but for simplicity, we will create one using AWS SAM.

① Install AWS SAM

Run the following commands on Mac to install AWS SAM:
